short_summary: Service agreement for IT Help Desk Specialists on an as and when required basis
description: The Chief Digital Officer on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) and Canadian Coast Guard (CCG) requires the services of IT Help Desk Specialists on an as and when required basis to support DFO employees with different IT equipment related tasks.
full_summary:
# IT Help Desk on Demand – B.10 Help Desk Specialist level 1 & 2

## Tender Details

* **Buyer Information**
	+ **Buyer Name**: Fisheries and Oceans Canada
	+ **Buyer Address**: 200 Kent St, Ottawa, ON K1A 0E6, Canada
	+ **Buyer Contact**: Carina Della Valle, Carina.DellaValle@dfo-mpo.gc.ca, (343) 542-9691
* **Tender Reference Number**: CB-700-92213131
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive, Selective Tender
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
* **Trade Agreements**: This contract may be closed with suppliers under various trade agreements, including but not limited to the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).
* **Expected Contract Start Date and End Date**: None
* **Location of Performance**: National Capital Region (NCR), Canada
* **Goods or Services Desired**: IT help desk services, specifically technical support and help desk process as a service.

## Acknowledgement

Fisheries and Oceans Canada, on behalf of the Chief Digital Officer (CDO), is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for IT Help Desk Specialists who will provide technical assistance to DFO employees as and when required.

## Sourcing Process

This procurement will be conducted using a Selective Tendering process.

## Evaluation Criteria

* The Contracting Authority will evaluate the proposals based on the quality of services offered and the pricing quote.

## Submission Procedure

The bidder must submit their proposal electronically through the Canada Buy 21 portal.

## Acknowledgement of Tender

It is the bidder's responsibility to ensure that their bid is submitted before the cutoff time on Closing Date to avoid late bid penalties.

Note that it is clear that this notice was created by the Government of Canada for the purpose of awarding a contract to one of its contractors. It appears that English language captioning in French is missing.
